{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3524149,"name":"Archit ","username":"bupersob","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bupersob/{size}/264721_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T23:21:33.319Z","cooked":"

Our robot’s CAN bus is based on a REV ecosystem, with Spark Maxes and Spark Flexes, and we just purchased a CANdi to integrate a beam break sensor. However, we aren’t able to detect the CANdi through Phoenix TunerX, and we think it’s because the roboRIO and CANdi have the same CAN id (namely 0). I even tried connecting the CANdi directly to the roboRIO, and the CANdi was alternating red which shows a CAN issue. I’m not sure how to troubleshoot next.

bupersob:

we think it’s because the roboRIO and CANdi have the same CAN id (namely 0).

That isn’t a problem because the roboRIO and the CANdi should have different device types. FRC CAN Device Specifications — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

Have you contacted CTRE support?

Alternating red indicates there is a CAN wiring issue. I would double checking wiring and send any pictures of your wiring setup if you can.

Figured it out, the green and yellow can wires were switched Thank you for the help.
